input: Which one of the following statements about the process of the Parliament to make new States is not correct? (CDS 2015-II)

options.A: The Parliament may by law form a new State and alter the boundaries or names of existing States.
options.B: A Bill to this effect cannot be introduced in the Parliament except on the recommendation of the President.
options.C: A Bill to this effect may be referred by the President to the Legislature of the affected State.
options.D: Such a law will fall under the purview of Article 368.

explanation: The Bill may be introduced in either House of Parliament to form a new state. It needs a prior permission of the President before introduction of the Bill.
